paragraphs.name: dddf
paragraphs.text: In my last blog post, we looked at a Sudoku graph as a way to explore the recently release K1 Coloring algorithm for Neo4j. Playing with a Sudoku grid could give us a good feel for graph coloring, but the K1 Coloring algorithm doesn’t always converge to the optimum solution…

paragraphs.name: 96d7
paragraphs.text: Coloring a Sudoku graph with Neo4j

paragraphs.name: 1ee6
paragraphs.text: I was happy to see that a recent release of the Neo4j graph algorithms contains the K-1 Coloring algorithm. This algorithm tries to assign colors to the nodes of a graph in such a way that adjacent nodes are different colors.

paragraphs.text: TriGraph: How to use graphs to analyse triathlon events

paragraphs.name: aaf9
paragraphs.text: Graphs are intuitive. Graphs are powerful. And graphs can be used in a wide range of applications. The goal of the article is to show how graphs can ease the data-analysis on top of a well-defined data model, in our example especially for triathlon events. To achieve this, we’re using…
